main event: Sighting of a greenish-white object that appeared to explode into several pieces over Arizona and California
interesting points: The pilot initially thought the object was a meteorite but later concluded it must have been much larger and at a lower altitude.
The report states that the object apparently exploded into several pieces.
The report concludes that the object was likely a large fireball, consistent with a satellite re-entry.
Multiple observers reported seeing the object, including a United Airlines pilot and observers at the Yuma Proving Grounds.

Authorities contacted various organizations like the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory and the U.S. Naval Observatory in Flagstaff to inquire about the sighting, but they did not have any reports.
sighted object: Greenish-white object that exploded into several pieces
witnesses: Pilot, observers at Yuma Proving Grounds
